title: Vegan Lime Bundt Cake
shortDescription: A tangy and delicious slice of lime, in the shape of a cake.
description: This cake derived from a cake made with yougurt and perfected over time. To add variety to my cake repertoire, I also make it replacing the lime with tangerine.
alt: A picture of a bundt cake
ingredients: 3/4 cup almond flour (important - don't replace with other flour)
1/2 cup powdered sugar (or granulated - if you like the texture - I use granulated)
directions: Grease the bundt pan with vegan butter and lightly dust with flour
In a mixing bowl, combine all ingredients without over-mixing
Pour the dough into the bundt pan and bake for about 45-48 minutes.
Use a toothpick to check if the cake is ready. Leave in the pan for 10 minutes. Then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely
Make the glaze: In a pot, combine the powdered sugar and the remaining juice, first one tablespoon - then one teaspoon at a time and stir well.
Bring to a boil and stir in the zest. Remove from heat
Once the cake has cooled, pour the glaze over the cake and sprinkle with the remaining zest. Enjoy!
Note: use less zest or omit, if preferred.
